title: La Toya Jackson, 63, exudes glamour in an eye-catching Fendi outfit
text:
Forever: King of Pop has been the Jackson Family's favourite tribute act since 2011.

And La Toya Jackson proved the family are still very much invested in its success as she posed for photographs at a press conference on Tuesday, ahead of the launch of Forever: The Best Show About The King Of Pop, in Mexico City.

The singer, 63, posed with her hands on her hips in a Fendi jumper and thigh-length socks of the same designer at the Centro Cultural Teatro in Mexico.

Sassy: La Toya Jackson posed for photographs at a press conference on Tuesday, ahead of the launch of Forever: The Best Show About The King Of Pop in Mexico City

Michael Jackson's sister cinched in her tiny waist with a thick black belt as her skintight leggings showed off the star's lean pins.

She waved to the crowds as she entered the stage in point toed leather Fendi boots and left her freshly blow dried hair loose to fall down her shoulders.

She enhanced her features with makeup and close-ups showed her beautifully manicured nails.

Support: The singer, 63, posed in a Fendi jumper and thigh-length socks and boots of the same designer at the Centro Cultural Teatro in Mexico

Glamorous: She enhanced her features with makeup and close-ups showed her beautifully manicured nails

Greeting: She waved to the crowds as she entered the stage in point toed leather Fendi boots and left her freshly blow dried hair loose to fall down her shoulders

Personal touch: La Toya stooped down to speak at one point during the press conference

It comes just four months after La Toya thanked fans of her late brother Michael Jackson for their vibrant memorials on the 10th anniversary of his death.

She wrote: 'Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! For the love and support you have all shown, your messages and nearly 19,000 lovely roses are much appreciated!

'Thank you for coming together in a beautiful way and gathering in the Circle of Love! This is exactly what he would’ve wanted!'

The Gary, Indiana native added, 'Again I thank you all for your love & support from all over the world!'

Serious: The American singer spoke about her late brother and the tribute act

You! The sister of Michael Jackson pointed to a member of the press for a question

Waves: La Toya smiled and waved to the press as she entered the stage to speak

Fans of the late Thriller singer, who died at the age of 50 in June on 25, 2009 as result of a drug overdose, congregated in multiple locations to pay memorial.

More than 200 fans flocked to the mausoleum where Jackson is laid to rest, at Glendale, California's Forest Lawn Memorial Park, playing Jackson's music and placing flowers and pictures of the late Beat It singer at the site.

They observed a moment of silence at 2:26 p.m. - the moment of the singer's death, and then chanted his name and sang his uplifting 1991 ballad Heal the World.

Other California-based memorials were held outside of the Neverland Ranch where he used to reside, outside of Los Olivos; by the mansion he overdosed at in the Holmby Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles; and by the singer's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Legs crossed: She put her hands on her hips and crossed her ankles as La Toya prepared to answer questions about the show
